slug: /117
title: "This Week In React #117: React criticism, useEvent, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, Expo, Storybook, Ignite, React-Native, TypeScript, Qwik..."

date: 09-27-2022
---
Hi everyone!
This week we have some interesting React criticisms to read.

segments.source_content: The newsletter **is finally back to its usual weekly rhythm**! I'm just back from vacations, and I took the opportunity to change my email provider: I'm now using [ConvertKit](https://thisweekinreact.com/ck). This gives me more flexibility on the email rendering and will allow me to introduce some new features later ;)

Cela me donne plus de flexibilitÃ© sur le rendu des emails et me permettra d'introduire de nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s plus tard ;)

Je reviens tout juste de vacances, et j'en ai profitÃ© pour changer mon fournisseur d'email : j'utilise dÃ©sormais [ConvertKit](https://thisweekinreact.com/ck). segments.source_content: The author of React-Admin gives a fair criticism of React on many aspects (forms, useContextSelector, refs, deps array...). Don't miss [Dan Abramov's response](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1572590212647391235).

translations.fr: L'auteur de React-Admin formule une critique Ã©quitable de React sur de nombreux aspects (formulaires, useContextSelector, refs, tableau de dÃ©pendances...). Ne manquez pas [la rÃ©ponse de Dan Abramov](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1572590212647391235).
translations.en: L'auteur de React-Admin donne une critique Ã©quitable de React sur de nombreux aspects (formulaires, useContextSelector, refs, tableau de dÃ©pendances...). Ne manquez pas la [rÃ©ponse de Dan Abramov](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1572590212647391235).

segments.source_content: **[Next.js Layouts RFC in 5 minutes](https://vercel.com/blog/next-js-layouts-rfc-in-5-minutes)**

The file-system based Next.js router will be significantly upgraded in the next major release. It includes support for nested layouts (like in Remix). This allows to avoid unnecessary unmount/remount of a layout during browsing, but also to manage data loading and errors. This article gives a quick overview. See also [Delba's thread](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1568291558776274945).

translations.fr: Le routeur Next.js basÃ© sur le systÃ¨me de fichiers sera considÃ©rablement amÃ©liorÃ© dans la prochaine version majeure. Il inclut le support des layouts imbriquÃ©s (comme dans Remix). Cela permet d'Ã©viter le dÃ©montage/remontage inutile d'un layout pendant la navigation, mais aussi de gÃ©rer le chargement des donnÃ©es et les erreurs. Cet article donne un aperÃ§u rapide. Voir aussi [le thread de Delba](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1568291558776274945).
translations.en: Le routeur Next.js basÃ© sur le systÃ¨me de fichiers sera considÃ©rablement amÃ©liorÃ© dans la prochaine version majeure. Il inclut le support des mises en page imbriquÃ©es (comme dans Remix). Cela permet d'Ã©viter le dÃ©montage/remontage inutile d'une mise en page lors de la navigation, mais aussi de gÃ©rer le chargement des donnÃ©es et les erreurs. Cet article donne un aperÃ§u rapide. Voir aussi le [fil de Delba](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1568291558776274945).

segments.source_content: **[React Router 6.4](https://remix.run/blog/react-router-v6.4)**
Big update: as expected, many Remix APIs (data-loading, mutation...) have finally been moved to React-Router. See the [2min video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aX74DbFT5nI)

translations.fr: Grosse mise Ã  jour : comme prÃ©vu, de nombreuses API Remix (chargement de donnÃ©es, mutations...) ont finalement Ã©tÃ© intÃ©grÃ©es Ã  React-Router. Voir la [vidÃ©o de 2min](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aX74DbFT5nI)
translations.en: Grosse mise Ã  jour : comme prÃ©vu, de nombreuses API de Remix (chargement de donnÃ©es, mutation...) ont finalement Ã©tÃ© dÃ©placÃ©es vers React-Router. Regardez la [vidÃ©o de 2min](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aX74DbFT5nI).

segments.source_content: **[Whatâ€™s New In Gatsby 2022?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/09/new-gatsby-2022/)**

Paul upgraded his blog to the latest Gatsby v4 version and shares with us how he used the latest features. Deferred Static Generation can significantly reduce build time. See also [Gatsby 5 Umbrella Discussion](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/discussions/36609) and the video [Gatsby v5 Alpha Showcase](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C-WrnfUm33k): partial hydration is coming!

translations.fr: Paul a mis Ã  jour son blog vers la derniÃ¨re version Gatsby v4 et partage comment il a utilisÃ© les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s. La GÃ©nÃ©ration Statique DiffÃ©rÃ©e peut rÃ©duire significativement le temps de build. Voir aussi [Gatsby 5 Umbrella Discussion](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/discussions/36609) et la vidÃ©o [Gatsby v5 Alpha Showcase](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C-WrnfUm33k) : l'hydratation partielle arrive !
translations.en: Paul a mis Ã  jour son blog vers la derniÃ¨re version Gatsby v4 et partage avec nous comment il a utilisÃ© les derniÃ¨res fonctionnalitÃ©s. La GÃ©nÃ©ration Statique DiffÃ©rÃ©e peut rÃ©duire considÃ©rablement le temps de build. Voir aussi la [Discussion Umbrella Gatsby 5](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/discussions/36609) et la vidÃ©o [Gatsby v5 Alpha Showcase](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C-WrnfUm33k) : l'hydratation partielle arrive !

## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}
**[RFC: File System-Based Native Routing with Expo and React Native](https://blog.expo.dev/rfc-file-system-based-routing-in-react-native-7a35474722a)**

translations.fr: **[RFC : Routage natif basÃ© sur le systÃ¨me de fichiers avec Expo et React Native](https://blog.expo.dev/rfc-file-system-based-routing-in-react-native-7a35474722a)**
translations.en: **[RFC : Routage natif basÃ© sur le systÃ¨me de fichiers avec Expo et React Native](https://blog.expo.dev/rfc-file-system-based-routing-in-react-native-7a35474722a)**

segments.source_content: Evan Bacon is working on a new Expo router based on file-system conventions, similar to Next.js or Remix. He tells us all we need to know about this highly anticipated feature that brings the DX of the web to mobile. This should considerably reduce the boilerplate of our apps, but also improve discoverability, deep linking, indexing, loading data, error handling... See also this [thread](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1574837248029331495) and this [podcast](https://podrocket.logrocket.com/expo-router).

translations.fr: Evan Bacon travaille sur un nouveau routeur Expo basÃ© sur des conventions de systÃ¨me de fichiers, similaire Ã  Next.js ou Remix. Il nous explique tout ce qu'il faut savoir sur cette fonctionnalitÃ© trÃ¨s attendue qui apporte la DX du web au mobile. Cela devrait considÃ©rablement rÃ©duire le code rÃ©current de nos applications, mais aussi amÃ©liorer la dÃ©couvrabilitÃ©, le deep linking, l'indexation, le chargement des donnÃ©es, la gestion des erreurs... Voir aussi ce [thread](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1574837248029331495) et ce [podcast](https://podrocket.logrocket.com/expo-router).
translations.en: Evan Bacon travaille sur un nouveau routeur Expo basÃ© sur des conventions de systÃ¨me de fichiers, similaire Ã  Next.js ou Remix. Il nous explique tout ce qu'il faut savoir sur cette fonctionnalitÃ© trÃ¨s attendue qui apporte la DX (Developer Experience) du web au mobile. Cela devrait considÃ©rablement rÃ©duire le code rÃ©current de nos applications, mais aussi amÃ©liorer la dÃ©couvrabilitÃ©, le deep linking, l'indexation, le chargement des donnÃ©es, la gestion des erreurs... Voir aussi ce [thread](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1574837248029331495) et ce [podcast](https://podrocket.logrocket.com/expo-router).

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Jobs {#jobs}
ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

segments.source_content: ğŸ’¡ [How to publish an offer ?](https://thisweekinreact.com/sponsor)
## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}

- [Qwik and Qwik City have reached beta!](https://www.builder.io/blog/qwik-and-qwik-city-have-reached-beta): cutting-edge framework, React challenger based on resumability instead of hydration
- [TypeScript 4.9 beta](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-4-9-beta/): new feature `satisfies` highly anticipated!
- [Token CSS](https://twitter.com/tokencss/status/1571823928187633664): possible alternative to Tailwind?
- [Updates from the 92nd TC39 meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-92nd-tc39-meeting-5fi6): small update
- [Cloudflare - workerd: the Open Source Workers runtime](https://blog.cloudflare.com/workerd-open-source-workers-runtime/)
- [Meta - MemLab: An open source framework for finding JavaScript memory leaks](https://engineering.fb.com/2022/09/12/open-source/memlab/)
- [Type-Level TypeScript](https://type-level-typescript.com/)
- TotalTypeScript [Tips](https://www.totaltypescript.com/tips) + [Zod tutorial](https://www.totaltypescript.com/tutorials/zod)
- [Ezno, new type-checking compiler for JavaScript](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1573244310644199425)
- [Turborepo 1.5](https://twitter.com/turborepo/status/1573017581459488769)
- [tRPC 10 beta](https://twitter.com/alexdotjs/status/1571807618254905344)
- [2022 Web Almanac](https://almanac.httparchive.org/en/2022/)
- [Chrome Developers - Container queries begin to land in stable browsers](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/cq-polyfill/)
- [WebKit Features in Safari 16.0](https://webkit.org/blog/13152/webkit-features-in-safari-16-0/)
- [Best practices for creating a modern npm package](https://snyk.io/blog/best-practices-create-modern-npm-package/)
